incidents.name: Twilio Flex - Maintenance

incident_updates.body: We’re creating the notification comms in reference to a planned maintenance in all regions between 9:00 PM PST to 11:59PM Pacific Time on 07/29/2025. Since the reboot have been completed, we’re resolving this proactive communication. Systems are operational.

We’re creating this proactive comms in reference to a planned maintenance in all regions between 9:00 PM PST to 11:59PM Pacific Time on 07/29/2025.
We’ll start the cluster reboot in the next 10 minutes, which will last about 10 seconds. Customers may experience the following during the cluster reboots:
-Login failures for customers logging in via legacy SSO (customers with enhanced SSO are not impacted) or console.
-Customers that are already logged in may be logged out from Flex UI or Webchat.
-Customers using Webchat may be unable to initiate new sessions or see disruptions to their existing sessions (token refresh failure).
-Customers should be able to re-login after the impact period in case of login failure during the maintenance window.

We are noticing MMS delivery delays affecting a subset of short code senders and carriers. Our engineering team are actively investigating the issue. We will provide an update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
We're currently receiving timeouts from Vibes when sending MMS requests, which could result in delays or failures delivering outbound MMS messages via that provider.

incidents.name: RealtimeTranscription and Voice Gather Degraded

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing issues with Real-time Transcription, Conversation Relay, and Voice Gather. This incident has been resolved following remediation efforts by our Speech-to-Text (STT) vendor, Google. This incident has been resolved.

We are observing recovery across Real-time Transcription, Conversation Relay, and Voice Gather, following remediation efforts implemented by our Speech-to-Text (STT) vendor, Google. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We've identified an issue affecting Real-time Transcription, Conversation Relay, and Voice Gather, caused by elevated latency from our Speech-to-Text (STT) vendor, Google. Their team is working to isolate and resolve the problem, and we're actively coordinating with them. STT services not using Google remain fully operational. We'll share another update in 4 hours or sooner as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Newly Signed up Customers Requesting a Managed Certificate for Link Shortening in Messaging, Will Stay in Pending Status With “Your Certificate Is Being Processed.”

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the newly signed up customers requesting a managed certificate for link shortening in messaging, will stay in pending status with “Your Certificate Is Being Processed.” All current customers using the messaging API will not be impacted on their operations, and it was determined that the impact was limited to a small set of customers, who have been contacted individually to address any concerns. All systems are operational.
